body: They are talking about 2.6.7 is available, is that a better choice? This is also a Dubbo bug... sadly.
The docker file in this repo is for development only. Build the current version to an image for the developer.
We need to use `cmake` to build the image locally.

Got it. In this case, should we add a README.md to the folder to clearly state the purpose? Most users will try to start it and find it doesn't work out of the box. In the readme, we can direct them to the right docker repository if they just want to set up a development environment. I can create a PR for it.
Yes. That makes sense. Would you like to submit a pull request?
/run ci
@candyleer Let me do some JDK9 test tomorrow, and how it works based on @raphw suggestions.

> They are talking about 2.6.7 is available, is that a better choice? This is also a Dubbo bug... sadly.

Sad……
2.6.X merges  my pr…… But 2.6.7 never …… 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2881751/62058205-a0b8b500-b253-11e9-99d6-d361112e879b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2881751/62058277-c34ace00-b253-11e9-9607-5983fe9dfdfc.png)
Maybe 2.6.8…… I cannot wait for it

Apache can't randomly release, and each release is unchangeable. So... I am afraid Dubbo community did the right thing. Only the next release is an option. We could ask a Dubbo committer do patch release, such as 2.6.7-patch1, if the community accepts that.

@aiyanbo The `AsyncUnaryRequestCallCallInterceptor` used to intercept the `UNARY` GRPC service,  the  `UNARY` service is blocking service and I'm curious that the blocking service calls by streaming service, so could you send me the demo to reproduce this issue?
You are right, so spring-cloud-alibaba comes back to alibaba repo.  Thanks for replying

@shook2012 Your issue doesn't belong to this topic. This is a namespace bug, which has been fixed too.
Is this issue: 3017 that has been fixed?
How about I add a spring bean named skyWalkingDynamicField to avoid this problem ?  @wu-sheng  In this mechanism maybe skywalking never need this field?
SkyWalking plugin requires this field. I doubt this w/ highly possible risks.
Yes. #3017 is the one.

Read the changelog, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md, we removed the login, due to Security vulnerabilities reported. We don't have committers to make sure it works, so removed.
`bootstrapJarTmp` folder and document related to it have been removed permanently, as we use unsafe injection in this PR.
/run e2e

One question, why the case is so quickly, AFAIK, the agent cooldown should be 10 mins in default.

I saw the `table: alarm_record does not exist` log, which could represent the rebooting, but the time doesn't make sense. Please verify again.

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/aiyanbo/testReport-master-2019-08-01-21-58.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/198/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-01-21-58.log)

If you are talking about OKHttp 4, then you need this PR CI works, and add the test cases to https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases. We have cases in OKHttp 3.x, you need to add 4.x

This PR is only offer two new ways for good gc and performance 
 And  should be 100% compatible  with old code

I am not clear the PR workflow, how to ` cc  all @apache/skywalking-committers `

> This PR is only offer two new ways

That is the key reason we can't accept. We usually don't open new API, because developers are hard to choose.  You could check all APIs today, 99% of them are open 2 years ago. If we keep changing it and opening new, it is nearly impossible to maintain it.

This kind of API change PR, you need to have a certain scenario, which causes `have to change`

Again, I am not saying your codes are not better, I am talking more about the open-source project practice. Only make API change when have to or have a performance issue.
/run e2e
The document has said that. If ElasticSearch is set as storage, then core TTL will be ignored.
@heyanlong @liuhaoyang @ascrutae Please notice this. The reboot command has been supported in OAP and Java agent. Please consider supporting this in PHP, .NetCore and Nodejs.

By learning your design, 
it seems that asyncStop and isInAsyncMode are very different things to do, 
isInAsyncMode is only viewed in the asyncFinish method, 
asyncStop has view and assignment in the asyncFinish method, and there is code logic in the middle, 
obviously It will still be executed multiple times.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/5036e8334301322d49973005cd98513c17b0f28f/docs/en/setup/backend/ttl.md
This document has not said that.
